snippet: The Spanish-language broadcaster, which owns the networks Univision and Galavisión, did not say how many shares it intended to sell in the offering.
abstract: Univision, largest Spanish-language broadcaster in the United States, files for initial public stock offering; details of offering are not disclosed, but company lists initial funds target of $100 million.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED and CHAD BRAY

lead_paragraph: The Spanish-language broadcaster, which owns the networks Univision and Galavisión, did not say how many shares it intended to sell in the offering.

headline.main: Univision Intends to Pursue I.P.O. in U.S.
headline.print_headline: Univision Plans to Sell Its Stock to the Public
